intro: Habenorkis, commonly known as the spider orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to various regions in Africa, Madagascar, and parts of Asia, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plants are characterized by their unique, intricate flower structures, often resembling spiders or other small creatures. They typically have slender stems and produce small, clustered flowers in shades of white, yellow, and green. Habenorkis species are often epiphytic, growing on trees or rocks, and require well-drained, nutrient-rich substrates for optimal growth.
